blog_desc: a contemporary church in Lafayette, Indiana helping people find full life in Christ

posts.alt_excerpt: Since last Fall, we have been talking about the need for us to finally get into a building of our own. We have discussed the need to have a building with more space, we have discussed the fact that it's cheaper to own than to rent, and we have gone through an extensive process of…
posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content:
Since last Fall, we have been talking about the need for us to finally get into a building of our own. We have discussed the need to have a building with more space, we have discussed the fact that it's cheaper to own than to rent, and we have gone through an extensive process of studying God's word together and asking people to make personal financial commitments all in the hope that God would open a door of opportunity for us. I'm beginning to think he has done just that. In just the past three weeks, we have become aware of the building at 2301 Concord Road and the potential that building has to become our new home. Now, to take a step back, I need to tell you that when we finished the pledge drive portion of our capital campaign, it was difficult for me to fight back the feelings of disappointment. We had a goal to raise $550,000 in our pledge drive, but the actual pledges we have raised as of today are $135,001. That's a far cry from the $550,000 we were trying to raise, but I had posted something to our FAQ that is really relevant today...

What if we don't raise enough money?

Strangely, Pastor Jeff is not worried about this. He’s fully convinced that God is going to provide for us the amount of money He thinks we should have at this point in time.However, if we don’t get enough commitments to reach our goal, that must mean that God’s plan for us is different from what we had been thinking. If we don’t reach our goal, we will take that as a sign from God of the following things:
  1. It must not be time for us to consider building a building on the southside.
  2. It must be time for us to reconsider how we can maximize the space we are in or look again for alternate meeting space.
  3. Perhaps God wants us to simply save up the money as we keep our eyes open for the opportunity he will bring our way.
In light of our actual campaign totals, we put our dreams of financing new construction on the back burner, started looking again for a meeting space, started new negotiations with our landlord, and kept our eyes open for other opportunities. Well, we believe God led Pastor Billy to find a listing on a local real estate website for the building at 2301 Concord, and you should know some of these amazing statistics:
  • This building is 10,700 square feet. When we started the process last Summer of praying for and looking for a new location for us, our target building size was 10,000 square feet!
  • This building has a listed purchase price of $500,000. That's the amount we thought we needed so that we could finance a $3M building, but when we didn't reach that target, our financial coach encouraged us to just trust that God would provide the $500,000 somehow over the next three years.
  • The owner has agreed to sell it to us for $400,000! That's a 20% discount right off the bat meaning that we can finance the building with only $25,000 as a downpayment.
  • Based on these numbers and our relationship with the Cornerstone Fund, we believe we will be able to fully fund the purchase and the renovation of this property with money we already have on hand!
  • Finally, after taking possession of this property, we expect to save $2000 per month compared to our current rent!
Amazingly enough, all the numbers seem to be lining up just perfectly to make us believe that God has put this opportunity in front of us.

Some Photos

Click a photo to see a larger version. [gallery link="none" ids="4497,4501,4503,4502,4514,4508,4506,4507,4511,4510,4505"]

There's just one problem...

However, in spite of all these awesome things, there is one major concern: location. Of course, they say that location is the most important consideration in all real estate, and from one perspective this location is amazing. The building is visible from the mall, and it is near the Toys R Us. However, from another perspective, there's a problem. The building is also right next to an adult gift store and a strip club. Jen and I have always been confused at the juxtaposition of these two "adult" businesses right next to the Toys R Us, and the thought of putting our church right next to them too, is a little strange and upsetting at first. Honestly, the thought of moving our church home next door to these businesses has caused a great deal of concern in my heart and in the hearts of other key leaders in our church. Of course, the entire reason we exist as a church is to try to help people discover life in Christ rather than in all the poor substitutes this world offers us. In that light, it may be a perfect act of grace on our part to move right next to a business that is filled with potentially misguided and needy people each night. However, we will need to take our steps carefully if we are to walk the line of blessing our neighbors, promoting holiness, and protecting ourselves from the influences and dangers that might be associated with asking people to bring their families to this location every week.

Please Pray

In light of all this, I and the leaders of LCC are asking you to pray with us and for us as we attempt to make this decision. There are so many signs that are pointing us to believe that this is the opportunity from God we have been waiting for. But there is the very real challenge of figuring out what ministry might look like for us in that part of the city. Ministry feels "safer" on the far south side of Lafayette, but this move has the potential to benefit us financially and also propel us forward in our mission to bring the love of Christ to people who don't know how much they are loved. There are many questions that still need to be answered, so we ask that you pray for us as we attempt to answer them.

posts.title: The Open Door We’ve Been Praying For?

posts.alt_excerpt: Easter is an Incredible Claim Easter is a cultural phenomenon these days, but it's also an incredible claim. It's the nearly incomprehensible claim that a man died a brutal death and then three days later spontaneously came back to life. Is it purely a matter of faith? Are there any real reasons to believe Jesus rose…
posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content:
Easter is an Incredible Claim

Easter is a cultural phenomenon these days, but it's also an incredible claim. It's the nearly incomprehensible claim that a man died a brutal death and then three days later spontaneously came back to life. Is it purely a matter of faith? Are there any real reasons to believe Jesus rose again? If it actually happened, what difference does it make anyway?

We're Answering Questions this Easter

On Easter Sunday, April 5, at each of our morning worship gatherings, we will be talking about the answers to these three questions, and on top of that, we will be answering your live questions on the topic! And we will be doing it all while your kids are having the most fun Easter morning they have ever had.

Easter is for Kids too!

Of course, our wonderful Kidopolis program will be in full-swing for kids of all ages up through 5th grade, and our Easter Sunday Kidopolis is a major do-not-miss event!

When and Where?

We invite you to join us for this very special Easter Sunday at either of our two worship gatherings, and we invite you to share with all your friends which gathering you plan to attend by using these Facebook Event links:
  • The Proof of Easter (Lafayette Community Church) @ 9 am
  • The Proof of Easter (Lafayette Community Church) @ 10:45 am
  • Pre-register Your Children Here

posts.alt_excerpt: We Are Better Together from Converge on Vimeo. Did you know that Lafayette Community Church is part of a larger network of churches called Converge? Why? Well, it's because we believe we are better together. In this video, you can hear our network president sharing a little of his heart regarding our movement of churches.
posts.author: Pastor Jeff

posts.alt_excerpt: Ladies! We will run a very short women's study starting Monday, February 23 at 6:30. It will last just 4 weeks. We will using Bill Hybels' study guide Too Busy Not To Pray. Unfortunately, we will not be able to offer child care this time around. But we hope you can each find a way…
posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content: Ladies! We will run a very short women's study starting Monday, February 23 at 6:30. It will last just 4 weeks. We will using Bill Hybels' study guide Too Busy Not To Pray. Unfortunately, we will not be able to offer child care this time around. But we hope you can each find a way to make it any how!! Sign up for the study here: http://www.signupgenius.com/go/10c0e4fa5a929a6f94-toobusy (We have plans for another study this summer!! Probably one by Angela Thomas.)

Unfortunately, we will not be able to offer child care this time around. But we hope you can each find a way […]
posts.filtered:
Ladies! We will run a very short women’s study starting Monday, February 23 at 6:30. It will last just 4 weeks.

We will using Bill Hybels’ study guide Too Busy Not To Pray.

Unfortunately, we will not be able to offer child care this time around. But we hope you can each find a way to make it any how!!

Sign up for the study here: http://www.signupgenius.com/go/10c0e4fa5a929a6f94-toobusy

(We have plans for another study this summer!! Probably one by Angela Thomas.)

posts.alt_excerpt: Kevin surprised us and the whole worship band last week by spontaneously leading us in his unfinished song, but when the rest of the band got into the groove, the song simply came together on its own. The band had never even heard this song before they played it live in the first worship gathering!…
posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content: Kevin surprised us and the whole worship band last week by spontaneously leading us in his unfinished song, but when the rest of the band got into the groove, the song simply came together on its own. The band had never even heard this song before they played it live in the first worship gathering! This recording is from the second worship gathering.

posts.filtered:
Kevin surprised us and the whole worship band last week by spontaneously leading us in his unfinished song, but when the rest of the band got into the groove, the song simply came together on its own.

The band had never even heard this song before they played it live in the first worship gathering! This recording is from the second worship gathering.

posts.alt_excerpt: During December of 2014, the people of LCC rallied in our largest ever expression of financial generosity. Through small donations as well as large, we were able to gather thousands of dollars for starting new churches in Indiana, launching our own building fund, and most importantly, helping out a local agency right here in Lafayette…
posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content: During December of 2014, the people of LCC rallied in our largest ever expression of financial generosity. Through small donations as well as large, we were able to gather thousands of dollars for starting new churches in Indiana, launching our own building fund, and most importantly, helping out a local agency right here in Lafayette that is doing amazing work sharing the love of Christ with others. Melissa McAtee, the CEO of Matrix Pregnancy Resource Center, will be joining us this Sunday to share with us their mission and her heart for the ministry they do, and we are going to bless their socks off with a major financial gift. If you are anywhere near Lafayette this weekend, make a point of joining us at one of our Sunday worship gatherings to celebrate the astonishing miracle that God made possible through your generosity last month! Oh, and come to the 9am gathering if you want to see the look on Melissa's face when she first sees the check!

posts.filtered:
During December of 2014, the people of LCC rallied in our largest ever expression of financial generosity. Through small donations as well as large, we were able to gather thousands of dollars for starting new churches in Indiana, launching our own building fund, and most importantly, helping out a local agency right here in Lafayette that is doing amazing work sharing the love of Christ with others.

Melissa McAtee, the CEO of Matrix Pregnancy Resource Center, will be joining us this Sunday to share with us their mission and her heart for the ministry they do, and we are going to bless their socks off with a major financial gift. If you are anywhere near Lafayette this weekend, make a point of joining us at one of our Sunday worship gatherings to celebrate the astonishing miracle that God made possible through your generosity last month!

Oh, and come to the 9am gathering if you want to see the look on Melissa’s face when she first sees the check!

posts.author: Pastor Jeff
posts.content:
On Sunday, I announced the launching of our church's first ever building fund, but I didn't have time to go into all the details about how it is all going to work. Let me explain it now.

Remember Last Year?

Last year at Christmastime, we were given a grant of $5000 to match another $5000 that we raised, and we gave all of that money to the local chapter of the Salvation Army. Perhaps you were there that Sunday when we presented the check to General Jim Irvin. It was an incredibly memorable moment. I know Jim was shocked when he saw that we were giving him over $10,000, and apparently other people were so inspired by your gift through LCC that they chose to match our gift again, and before the month was over, the Salvation Army had received around $20,000 sparked by our little church!

We're Doing It Again!

To my delight, we are eligible again this year to receive the very same matching grant as part of a statewide campaign called Love Indiana. Churches like us all over the state are going to be raising their generosity quotient as they collect money and food for local organizations, and there is no way we would let that train pass us by. This year, we have selected Matrix Pregnancy Resource Center as our recipient organization, and we plan to raise enough money to knock their socks off!

What About the Building Fund?

Well, this year is a little different from last year. In fact, it's different from all our previous years. Throughout 2014, after much research and prayer, the leadership of the church has decided that it's time for us to start putting some money aside for the purchase of land and the building of a building. If you want to know more about our decision-making process, you can read my recent blog post: Exciting Times. Therefore, for the first time in our church history, we are attempting to raise funds for one of our own projects. Usually, we raise money for other organizations, but it's time for us to take our future into our own hands and put some money aside for that, and to that end, we are going to dovetail our building fund with our Love Indiana project, and attempt to do them both at the same time.

So... How Will that Work?

Now, we know that some of you are going to be really excited to give to our new Building Fund. You might be so eager to see this church move forward that you'll decide to give all your money to the Building Fund and not to Matrix at all. Others of you might be just the opposite. You'll want to support Matrix now, and try to do the Building Fund sometime later. I get that. I really do. However, I and the elders are so committed to both of these projects that we are doing this: Through December 2014, we will be receiving donations to our General Fund as usual (undesignated gifts), but we will also be receiving gifts labeled Christmas Generosity (just like last year). All gifts to the Christmas Generosity fund will be split 50/50. Well, 45,45,10 really. The first 10% of everything we receive during our Christmas Generosity Campaign will go to the church planting efforts of Converge MidAmerica, the organization that gave us a hand up when we started. We do that because even as a church organization, we are committed to the tithe principle. The remaining money will be split 50-50 between our new Building Fund and Matrix PRC as part of the Love Indiana project (which has a $5000 matching grant cap). But here's the amazing thing, I want you to remember: Every dollar that gets marked for Matrix will get doubled by the Love Indiana matching grant up to $5000! That means, if we raise $11,000, roughly $1000 will go to church planting, $5000 will go to our building fund, but $10,000 will go to Matrix!

Shameless Plea for Money

I want you to spend less money this year on Christmas and invest more of your money in the work of God's Kingdom here in Lafayette and throughout the state of Indiana! So from now until the end of December, whenever you can, I want you to write an extra check to the church with the words Christmas Generosity in the memo line. You can also use our Online Giving Page or your bank's bill pay feature to do the same thing. All that money will go to these three strategic efforts: planting churches in Indiana, blessing the socks off Matrix, and setting up our very first Building Fund. Can you make your first gift, however large or small, today? Checks can be mailed here: Lafayette Community Church
PO Box 4993
Lafayette, IN 47903 Or you can use our Online Giving Page.

Remember Last Year?

Usually, we raise money for other organizations, but it’s time for us to take our future into our own hands and put some money aside for that, and to that end, we are going to dovetail our building fund with our Love Indiana project, and attempt to do them both at the same time.

The first 10% of everything we receive during our Christmas Generosity Campaign will go to the church planting efforts of Converge MidAmerica, the organization that gave us a hand up when we started. We do that because even as a church organization, we are committed to the tithe principle.

Every dollar that gets marked for Matrix will get doubled by the Love Indiana matching grant up to $5000!

That means, if we raise $11,000, roughly $1000 will go to church planting, $5000 will go to our building fund, but $10,000 will go to Matrix!

Shameless Plea for Money

I want you to spend less money this year on Christmas and invest more of your money in the work of God’s Kingdom here in Lafayette and throughout the state of Indiana!

So from now until the end of December, whenever you can, I want you to write an extra check to the church with the words Christmas Generosity in the memo line. You can also use our Online Giving Page or your bank’s bill pay feature to do the same thing.

All that money will go to these three strategic efforts: planting churches in Indiana, blessing the socks off Matrix, and setting up our very first Building Fund.

Can you make your first gift, however large or small, today?

Checks can be mailed here:

Lafayette Community Church
PO Box 4993
Lafayette, IN 47903

Or you can use our Online Giving Page.
